comments.commentBody: That sound you hear is teabaggers' heads exploding.
A new coat of paint on an Edsel doesn't change the fact its an Edsel.   The public may be temporarily dazzled by the paint, but this car will not leave the lot.

I'd rather have them conduct a lottery and give 100 thousand of us 150 thousand each. Jobs bill? Give me a break ... oh yeah ... another tax break for businesses. When will the government realize they can not spend their way out of a recession. First, we the people must stop asking government to solve our problems for us. Second, we must go to war only when we have the intention to defeat the clearly defined enemy. Third, Stop subsidizing businesses with tax breaks, direct subsidies, grants etc. Special interest lobbyists and organizations would be out of work if there wasn't so much of our money available. Turn off the faucet and they go away.

A really nice piece of work on the write-up, Jim! Thanks tremendously! It really gave me a lift! Thanks to the commentators for the remarks. I apologize for not posting Friday. I was surprised when I saw my byline. I could hardly remember the puzzle. It was submitted in October 2008. Lots of  clues had been changed. I decided to solve it, so as to arm myself against the "This was too hard!" comments!! With help from Merl, Marie and Bonnie, I was able to finish the puzzle in 25 minutes! My clue for OFFICEBOY? [Gender-based employee title]. My clue for JOETHEPLUMBER? [Unlikely celeb during the 2008 Obama-McCain debates]. My clue for SPEEDSTER? [Punt returner, often]. My clue for JUDICIAL? [___ review]  In solving it, I made the same mistakes that everyone has commented on. I confidently put in ITDBE. I also whined about the usage of gopher, until I looked it up. Webster's Collegiate online lists "gofer" as a definition of "gopher." That makes it legit in my book. Or at least defensible. A great time was had by many in Brooklyn!  Vic
Got the fuel....
Deficit spending,  a moderate increase in the money supply, reasonable restrictions on credit, and limited, targeted tax increases, in combination, will help pave the road to economic recovery.
Help! This does not commute! Republicans doing something?
This has been a great week for Democrats. Best of all was that vote to say NO to the right wingnuts. Ron Paul yes.
What party is  Senator Ben Nelson in again?

This whole thing is farce: with the help of 5 Republicans, there will be an up and down vote on the bill. The point is we should not have this filibuster in the first place.  In any democracy, 58 Senators should be able to pass a bill. Period.
Business tax breaks do not create demand. If there is no increased demand, businesses have no incentive to hire, with or without a tax break.

Romulusrex -- Here you go;

http://whipcongress.com...

And get your brother Remusrex involved too.

Republicans are opposed to taxing the public. However if they and their descendants have to pay for any program, they should get their fair share of it. Any federal program will add 20-25% to the cost of anything that passes thru their hands. I oppose almost all federal programs, both I want my fair share. Judgement day is coming on Nov. 2, 2010.

A few weeks ago, in a statement typical of his party’s propensity for propaganda, newly-minted Senator Scott Brown (R-MA) forcefully asserted that the Obama administration’s economic stimulus package, “hasn’t created one new job.”

The problem with Brown’s declaration is that it’s objectively false. On Wednesday, the New York Times published a piece on the bill’s far-reaching impact. The results expose just how deceitful and irresponsible the senator’s remarks were.

So, there you have it. One year on, the Recovery Act is well on its way to accomplishing all of its stated objectives. Next time the junior senator from Massachusetts speaks out of turn, I suggest he do his homework beforehand.

Read more @ http://armchairfirebrand.wordpress.com/

With all due respect to some of the posters here...the reference to President Obama as a "Marxist" or " Socialist" is getting really old. I consider folks writing here to have  the smarts of  the well read and fair minded. But these references are silly and belong in supermarket tabloids or Fox News.

Given the past eleven months since Snowe and Collins (and Specter) voted with the Dems on the Stimulus Bill, it is heartening to see that there is again some bipartisnship with this bill. How cannot Republicans support a bill that addresses their manta to help small busunesses? Because they have to say "no" to make Obama look bad. There is no sense to thiat mantra... and we suffer from it to get people (including Republicans) back to work., I will have no problem digging necessary tenches to have work.
Even the sarcasm of #14 is relatively pedestrian. It's probably the elitist in me.

$15 Billion for the entire nation, $10 Billion less than they gave Goldman Sachs...There's your Democracy right there...!

Now if we did anyway with The United States Senate which is corrupted and undemocratic how much money would that save, they want to shrink government don't they well that would be a good start...right there...

Think about it we don't need them all we need is the United States Congress The People's Branch...This is really our House of Lords who needs them..really...think about it...

Tom Paine was dead against it, and Jefferson always suspicious of it, it's to easy to bribe them as well just takes a few Committee heads especially...

We could have a democracy again...don't change the filibuster get rid of the Senate...the whole thing is out of whack a few people in Utah ruling over 50 million in the North East...give me a break no wonder "Everything's Broken" as Dylan said it's the Senate...who needs them really they never leave and the pensions they get, security, plane flights, trips allover, they've out lived their usefulness and it's they who have chosen to do so...

Think about it no more corrupt bought off Senators of both parties...

Well that's one solution let them go look for jobs...

Gee, TR might have a point there. Why on Earth would anyone care if Ron Paul published a newsletter, in his own name, for decades without repudiating a word of the astonishing bigotry in it until he was called out on it? ...Oh yeah, maybe because they have a brain in their head.

Out of context???? TR has clearly never actually read the newsletter. I would just love to hear the context that makes it reasonable to suggest that NYC should be renamed "Welfaria" or "Zooville." Or the context where praise of David Duke, or condemnation of apartheid is acceptable. And I'd really love to hear the context where suggesting that gay AIDS victims be quarantined is okay. The list is nearly endless.

For a peek into the astonishing bigotry of Ron Paul's personal newsletter, with plenty of context, read this article:
http://www.tnr.com...

You will find many direct quotes from the Ron Paul Newsletter there, such as this one on the LA riots:

“Order was only restored in L.A. when it came time for the blacks to pick up their welfare checks three days after rioting began..”

I would just love to hear the context that makes that okay.

You will also find a large number of links to direct photocopies of the newsletter, with all the context that you could possibly need to know that the bigotry in it was absolutely unconscionable.

You folks who think this makes sense are fooling yourselves. So what if five republicans voted for this bill. So much more could be done if those who have been selected to represent us did just that.

You want change and your life to be better? Do it yourself. Work harder and smarter. Stop relying on anyone but yourself to make YOUR life better. It has been accomplished by millions of people for generations. What makes you think this time is any different than before?

I'm waiting to hear a Republican politician's idea on how to create jobs that does not include yet another tax cut for the rich folks. Waiting.....waiting... okay I am kidding. The Republicans have no ideas.

whoopty freakin' doo!
$15B is "paper clip inventory" money in a $1T+ budget!
get the brooms out this fall and send all the incumbents home.
rookies can't be worse than the bums in office now.
SO they give the 17 trillions to Wall street for their bonuses and 15 billion to the middle class for a couple of jobs. Well we certainly see who they believe are more  important to their careers.
This is great but - maybe a few hundred billion shy of creating the jobs we need.

The blatant hypocrisy of the GnOP on the Stimulus Bill should continue to be exposed. Their railing and voting against it only to end up boasting about the amount of jobs and money it brought to their home states is beyond shameful. Lindsey "It Has Created No Jobs" Graham is just one of the latest to be exposed. Every GnOP Governor in the nation took Stimulus money after many of them politicized the Bill by publicly opposing it.
